title: Accidental Discharge at LPSO Firing Range
content:
At approximately 10:00AM on Monday December 12, 2016 the Lafayette Parish Sheriff’s Office received a report of an accidental discharge at its firing range on Michael Ann Drive.
At the time of the incident, a single round was fired inadvertently by a deputy who had just finished qualifying with his weapon.
Four nearby deputies received minor injuries as a result of shrapnel from a ricochet, however, no one was hit directly by a bullet. One of the deputies was transported by Acadian Ambulance to a nearby medical facility for further treatment due to a shrapnel fragment that was lodged below the knee. That deputy has since been released from medical care without requiring any surgery. The three other deputies who sustained minor injuries were also evaluated by medical personnel and have been cleared.
The names of the deputies involved are not being released at this time pending an internal investigation into this incident.
